confirmed_facts: Fire broke out on 26 November 2025 at approximately 2:50â€¯pm local time in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, HongÂ Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,400 units and housed roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
Firefighters classified the incident as a 5â€‘grade fire and are still conducting rescue and extinguishment operations.

timeline.event: Fire in Tai Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex; 13 fatalities reported.
